Educational Psychology Minor.Description: Focuses on foundational concepts in educational psychology.

Core.Details: Completion of 15 undergraduate semester credit hours in educational psychology.
At least six hours must be upper-division.

Requirements.Notes: Information about available courses and certification process is available from the Department of Educational Psychology, George I. Sanchez Building 504.

Kinesiology and Health Education Minor.Description: Provides a foundation in kinesiology and health education concepts.

Core.Details: A cumulative 2.5 UT Austin GPA is required for admission.
Completion of 15 undergraduate semester credit hours in Kinesiology (KIN) or Health Education (HED).
At least six hours must be upper-division.

Requirements.Notes: Information about available courses and certification process is available from the Student Dean's Office, George I. Sanchez Building 2.110.

Urban Teachers Minor.Description: Prepares students for secondary teacher certification in English/Language Arts or Social Studies.
Urban Teachers Minor.Admission: By admission only with a 2.5 overall UT Austin GPA.

Courses: EDC 370S (Topic 1: Advanced Methods in English, Language Arts, and Reading)
EDC 370S (Topic 3: Advanced Methods in Social Studies)

Details: EDC 351S with EDC 671S or EDC 371S with EDC 651S for English
EDC 351S with EDC 671S or EDC 371S with EDC 651S for Social Studies

Requirements.Notes: The minor requires a three-semester commitment (summer, fall, spring).
